articles.title: The stock market winners and losers of 2025 - Financial Times
articles.description: Chips, gold and guns have triumphed while ad companies and private equity struggled

articles.title: AI-linked IPOs in China are exploding. But it's not easy for foreigners to join the party - CNBC
articles.description: China's hottest artificial-intelligence listings are delivering eye-popping gains. However, it may not be easy for overseas investors to partake in the rally.

articles.title: Japan official warns on yen’s ‘sudden’ weakness - Financial Times
articles.description: Traders see higher potential for government intervention to support currency

articles.title: Waymo resumes service in San Francisco after robotaxis stall during blackout - TechCrunch
articles.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

articles.title: Bourbon maker Jim Beam halts production at main distillery for a year - BBC
articles.description: US distillers face uncertainty after President Trump imposed tariffs on countries around the world.

articles.title: China keeps benchmark lending rates steady for a seventh straight month despite weak economic data - CNBC
articles.description: The People's Bank of China kept its 1-year and 5-year loan prime rates unchanged at 3% and 3.5% respectively, holding them for a seventh straight meeting.

articles.title: How a power outage in Colorado caused U.S. official time be 4.8 microseconds off - NPR
articles.description: Officials said the error is likely be too minute for the general public to clock it, but it could affect applications such as critical infrastructure, telecommunications and GPS signals.

articles.title: Gold Edges Higher Amid Geopolitical Tensions - The Wall Street Journal
Stock futures rise as traders look ahead to holiday-shortened week: Live updates - CNBC
articles.description: Wall Street is coming off a mixed week for the major averages.

articles.title: Permira, Warburg to buy investment and accounting software maker Clearwater Analytics for $8.4 billion - CNBC
articles.description: Clearwater agreed to be taken private for $24.55 a share cash, a premium of 47% on its share price of $16.69 on Nov. 10, before reports ‌of ‌a potential sale.

articles.title: Epidural kit shortage could last until March, regulator says - BBC
articles.description: The shortage is due to a major supplier stopping manufacturing epidural bags, the government says.

articles.title: MTA unveils new blaring-alarm fare gates at busy NYC stations to fight fare evasion - amNewYork
articles.description: The MTA unveiled new blaring-alarm fare gates that add to other fare evasion efforts, including gate guards, sleeves and more at NYC stations.

articles.title: Portland-based meat company recalls ready-made sausage - OregonLive.com
articles.description: Double-check your sausage before putting it out for guests this holiday season.

articles.title: Instacart to pay $60 million to customers in FTC settlement - Mashable
articles.description: The FTC lawsuit alleges the grocery delivery service engaged in deceptive tactics.

articles.title: Powerball jackpot climbs to $1.6 billion, among largest lottery prizes ever in U.S. - CNBC
articles.description: Monday's drawing would be the fifth-largest U.S. jackpot ever, according to a news release from Powerball.

articles.title: Super-popular Italian restaurant chain making major change - AL.com
articles.description: Customers can choose lighter versions of the same dishes and pay less

articles.title: United Airlines flight from Chicago to Orange County, California, diverted to Rockford - CBS News
articles.description: A United Airlines flight from Chicago's O'Hare International Airport to Southern California was diverted to Rockford on Sunday.

articles.title: Don’t give up on a ‘Santa Claus rally’ just yet — even after a rough December start for stocks - MarketWatch
articles.description: History shows the year-end period is historically a strong one for stocks, regardless of how they performed earlier in December
